name: "Thank you for participating in the Associated Student Body Social Experiment," new email from Skyline says
brief: Skyline High School has officially dissolved its Associated Student Body, and many are split on whether they made the right choice.
author: Derek Leeman

name: Sammamish City Council Bans All New Year's Parties
brief: Due to concerns over lawsuits and criminal cases, the City Council of Sammamish has stated that all New Year's parties fall under "disturbing the peace."
author: Derek Leeman

name: Opinion: The United States Should Legalize Unpaid Child Labor
brief: To deal with rampant inflation and to compete globally with factory production, it is the opinion of Dr. Jason Crobbler that we should legalize unpaid child labor.
author: Dr. Jason Crobbler

name: Issaquah School District School Board to take 60% of "Technology Levy" as bonuses
brief: As a congratulations for a job well done the School Board of the Issaquah School District are to take the remaining money in the Prop. 2 Capital levy as bonuses.
author: Derek Leeman

name: Issaquah and Sammamish to Close All Roads Coming Christmas Eve
brief: To deal with damage left from recent snowfall both cities have released a joint statement in which they declare they will be closing all roads for repairs on Christmas Eve as a gift to all drivers.
author: Derek Leeman

name: Students Caught Having Fun at Skyline High School, Police Called
brief: A group of students were caught during a snowball fight on November 29th, a police case has been filed and the Sammamish Police Department is on the lookout for the perpetrators.
author: Derek Leeman

name: IBO to Require Competency Test in Latin
brief: Along with this, the IBO are to add more strict requirements for new IB Diploma Path students to keep up with "power creep".
author: Garry Kidman

name: Issaquah School District Awards College Board with "Most Moral Non-Profit" Award
brief: The Issaquah School District recently announced College Board as the winner of their recent "Most Moral Non-Profit" competition.
author: Derek Leeman

name: Issaquah to update speed limit on I-90
brief: The city of Issaquah recently announced an update to the speed limit on I-90 to counteract continual failure to meet ticket quotas.
author: Derek Leeman

name: Puget Sound Energy displays new method to reduce power strain on generators
brief: In a now-deleted tweet they unveiled a possibly controversial method to stop the issues with generator strain.
author: Derek Leeman
